apps.name: Perplexityai
apps.description:
The Perplexity tool interfaces with Perplexity AI's search service, offering advanced natural language processing for sophisticated searches. The PerplexityAISearch action allows for:

    - Query execution with AI models tailored to various search tasks.
    - Search customization through parameters affecting content generation.
    - Domain filtering to enhance search precision.
    - Real-time response streaming for dynamic applications.

    This action is highly configurable for a tailored search experience, suitable for a wide range of AI-driven applications.

gmail.pythonCode:
from composio_openai import ComposioToolSet, App
  from openai import OpenAI

  openai_client = OpenAI()
  composio_toolset = ComposioToolSet(entity_id="default")

  tools = composio_toolset.get_tools(apps=[App.GMAIL])

composio.name: Composio

meta.description: Composio enables AI Agents and LLMs to authenticate and integrate with various tools via function calling.

actions.name: advanced_use_case_search
actions.description: Apps are like github, linear, gmail, etc. actions are like send email, create issue, etc programmatic functions that can be used to perform the action. not all apps support all actions. some apps support only a subset of actions that might be possible to perform with that app. use this action to search for apps that can be used to perform a specific use case. this list is only probabilistic. search apps for a specified usecase. so for example, if use case is to "send an email" this action will return all the apps that can be used to send email. similarly if use case is to "create a github issue" this action will return all the apps that can be used to create a github issue. after using this, to confirm whether the application can indeed potentially support the use case, use the action retrieve actions.

actions.name: check_active_connection
actions.description: Check if any active connections exist for a given tool or status of the connection with a specific id. if an active connection exists, the tool will return true, otherwise it will return false. active connections allow an agent to perform any actions on top of the tool.

actions.name: enable_trigger
actions.description: Enable a specific trigger for the authenticated user.

actions.name: execute_action
actions.description: Execute an action using the composio api.

actions.name: get_required_parameters
actions.description: This action retrieves the necessary parameters required to initiate a connection with a specified tool. for instance, linear may need an 'api key', zendesk might require a 'subdomain', and slack could need a 'webhook url'. the required parameters vary based on the authentication scheme employed. for example, api key authentication requires an api key, whereas oauth2 typically does not require any parameters because it involves redirecting the user to the tool's website for authorization.

actions.name: get_response_schema
actions.description: Retrieves the response schema for a specified composio action. this action fetches the complete response schema definition for any valid composio action, returning it as a dictionary that describes the expected response structure.

actions.name: initiate_connection
actions.description: Initiate a connection to a tool with the given parameters. for example, linear might require an api key to create a connection, which we can get by calling get required parameters. to create a new connection, we need to call create connection with the required parameters. similarly, zendesk might require a subdomain to create a connection, which we can get by calling get required parameters. to create a new connection, we need to call create connection with the subdomain.

actions.name: list_apps
actions.description: List all the available apps on composio with filtering options.

actions.name: list_triggers
actions.description: List available triggers and their configuration schemas.

actions.name: retrieve_actions
actions.description: Apps are like github, linear, gmail, etc. actions are like send email, create issue, etc programmatic functions that can be used to perform the action. get actions for a given usecase using similarity search. this actions are most relevant to the usecase but still might not be actual actions needed for the usecase. this decision should be made by you. this should be used to narrow down for an app, and find the most relevant actions for the usecase. in some cases, you might want to even check if the usecase is supported by the app or not.

actions.name: retrieve_apps
actions.description: Apps are like github, linear, gmail, etc. actions are like send email, create issue, etc programmatic functions that can be used to perform the action. not all apps support all actions. some apps support only a subset of actions that might be possible to perform with that app. use this action to retrieve the apps that can be used to perform the action. this list is only probabilistic. retrieve apps for a specified usecase. so for example, if use case is to "send an email" this action will return all the apps that can be used to send email. simiarly if use case is to "create a github issue" this action will return all the apps that can be used to create a github issue. after using this, to confirm whether the application can indeed potentially support the use case, use the action retrieve actions.

actions.name: wait_for_connection
actions.description: Wait for a connection to be established for a given tool or check the status of a connection with a specific id. wait for a given amount of time and then check again the status of the connection.

notion.name: Notion

optional.name: oauth_redirect_uri
optional.description: Add this Redirect URL to your app's OAuth allow list.

optional.name: scopes
optional.description: Scopes to request from the user, comma separated

required.name: api_key
required.description: Your notion API key for authentication. Obtain it from your notion settings.

meta.description: Notion centralizes notes, docs, wikis, and tasks in a unified workspace, letting teams build custom workflows for collaboration and knowledge management

actions.name: add_page_content
actions.description: Appends a single new content block to a specified notion page or block. to add multiple blocks, this action must be invoked multiple times. preconditions: - the `parent block id` must identify an existing notion page or one of the following block types that can contain child blocks: page, toggle, to-do, bulleted list, numbered list, callout, or quote. - the `content block` provided in the request must represent a valid notion block object structure. for details on block types and their structures, refer to the official notion api documentation. the new block can be appended at the end of the parent's content or positioned after a specific existing block if the `after` parameter is provided.

actions.name: create_comment
actions.description: Creates a new comment on a notion page or within an existing discussion thread. comments can be added in two primary ways: 1. as a new top-level comment directly on a page by specifying its `parent page id`. 2. as a reply to an existing discussion by specifying its `discussion id`. preconditions: - provide either `parent page id` (to comment on a page) or `discussion id` (to reply in a thread), but not both. - the `comment` parameter must be a notionrichtext object. a simple text comment would typically be structured as: `{"type": "text", "text": {"content": "your comment text"}}`. - the api does not support creating new discussion threads on specific blocks (inline comments) via this action; only page-level comments or replies to existing discussions are possible.

actions.name: create_database
actions.description: Creates a new database as a subpage under a specified parent page in notion, with a defined properties schema (columns). preconditions: - the `parent id` must be a valid uuid of an existing page in the notion workspace. - the `properties` list must define a valid schema. it's highly recommended to include at least one property of type 'title'. note: this action is exclusively for creating new databases. to modify the schema of an existing database (e.g., add, remove, or update columns/properties), please use the `update schema database` action. the provided database title will be automatically converted to notion's rich text format.

actions.name: create_notion_page
actions.description: Creates a new page in a notion workspace. this action allows you to create a new page with a specified title, optional icon, and optional cover image. the new page will be created under a designated parent page or database, identified by its uuid. preconditions: - the `parent id` must be a valid uuid of an existing page or database in the notion workspace. - if `icon` is provided, it must be a single emoji character. - if `cover` is provided, it must be a valid and publicly accessible image url. example request: { "parent id": "59833787-2cf9-4fdf-8782-e53db20768a5", "title": "my new project proposal", "icon": "🚀", "cover": "https://www.example.com/images/project cover.png" }

actions.name: delete_block
actions.description: Archives a specified block, page, or database in notion by its id. this action sets the 'archived' property of the target object to true. in the notion ui, this is equivalent to moving the item to the "trash". the archived item can be restored later via the api using actions such as 'update a block' or 'update page'. preconditions: - the `block id` must refer to an existing block, page, or database that the integration has permission to access. otherwise, the api will return an error (e.g., 404 not found).

actions.name: fetch_comments
actions.description: Fetches a list of unresolved comment objects associated with a specific notion block or page. this action supports pagination, allowing retrieval of comments in chunks. use the `block id` to specify the target page or block. the `start cursor` and `page size` parameters control pagination. preconditions: - the specified `block id` must correspond to an existing block or page accessible by the authenticated user.

actions.name: fetch_data
actions.description: Fetches a simplified list of notion pages, databases, or both, accessible to the connected notion integration. this action retrieves items along with their unique ids, titles, and types ('page' or 'database'). it simplifies the process of getting notion resource details by abstracting the complexity of notion's native search api response. the action processes the raw search results to extract essential information: - `id`: the unique identifier of the page or database. - `title`: the title of the page (derived from its properties) or database. defaults to "untitled page" or "untitled database" if not found. - `type`: the object type, either 'page' or 'database'. preconditions: - in the request, exactly one of the following fields must be set to `true`: `get pages`, `get databases`, `get all`.

actions.name: fetch_database
actions.description: Retrieves the complete metadata object for a specific notion database, identified by its `database id`. this object details the database's structure, including its title, icon, cover, properties (which define the columns, their types, and configurations), parent object, and other schema information. this action is used to understand the schema and properties of a database. it does not retrieve the actual data entries (pages or rows) stored within the database. for fetching database content, use a separate action designed for querying databases (e.g., an action like 'query database'). the response structure adheres to the notion api specification and respects any capability limits of the integration. preconditions: - the provided `database id` must be a valid identifier for an existing notion database that the integration can access.

actions.name: fetch_row
actions.description: Retrieves a specific row from a notion database by its page id. in notion, each row within a database is an individual page. this action fetches the properties and metadata of such a page. preconditions: - the provided `page id` must be a valid uuid and correspond to an existing page in the notion workspace. note: this action fetches the page's properties (i.e., row data). to retrieve the actual content blocks within a page, use the "fetch block children" action or a similar action designed for fetching page content.

actions.name: get_about_me
actions.description: Retrieves information about the bot user associated with the current notion integration token. this action returns a user object containing details such as: 1. the user id of the bot. 2. other information about the bot user, like its name and avatar url. the user id obtained can be used in other api calls that require a user identifier.

actions.name: get_about_user
actions.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific notion user, such as their name, avatar, and email, based on their unique user id. this action fetches user-specific data from notion. the response includes a dictionary with various attributes of the user. preconditions: - a valid `user id` corresponding to an existing notion user must be provided. the action will fail if the user id is missing or does not correspond to an accessible user.

actions.name: insert_row_database
actions.description: Creates a new page (row) in a specified notion database, allowing programmatic entry addition with various properties, an icon, a cover image, and initial content blocks. preconditions: - `database id` must be a valid identifier of an existing notion database that the integration can access. - property names and types in the `properties` field must match the target database schema. for example, a 'status' property of type 'select' must use 'select' as its type. - for `select` and `multi select` types, provided option values (e.g., "in progress" for 'status') must be defined in the database's configuration. using non-existent options will result in an error. - external urls for covers or files must be publicly accessible.

actions.name: list_users
actions.description: Retrieves a paginated list of users within the notion workspace. this action allows fetching users page by page. the number of users returned in a single response may be less than the requested `page size`. preconditions: - the workspace must have users. if no users exist, an empty list will be returned. note: guest users are not included in the list of users returned by this action.

actions.name: query_database
actions.description: Retrieves a list of pages (rows) from a specified notion database, with options for sorting and pagination. this action queries a notion database using its id, allowing results to be sorted by one or more properties. pagination is supported via `page size` and `start cursor`, enabling efficient retrieval of large datasets. each row is a page, and each column is a property. preconditions: * a valid `database id` for an existing notion database must be provided. * if using `sorts`, the `property name` in each sort object must correspond to an existing property in the target database. property names can be found by inspecting the database structure (e.g., fetching database metadata or checking notion directly). the response includes the retrieved pages and pagination details, such as a `next cursor` if more results are available. the number of results may be fewer than the specified `page size`.

actions.name: update_row_database
actions.description: Updates an existing notion database row (page), allowing you to modify its icon, cover, properties, or archive (delete) it. preconditions: `row id` must be a valid uuid of an accessible page. property names/ids in `properties` must match the database and values must use correct formats. property value formatting: each `propertyvalues.value` must follow notion api rules: - `title`, `rich text`: plain text (e.g., "project alpha plan") - `number`: number (e.g., 123, 45.67) - `select`: option name (e.g., "in progress") - `multi select`: comma-separated option names (e.g., "tag1,tag2") - `date`: iso 8601 date (e.g., "2023-10-26") - `people`: comma-separated notion user uuids - `url`: valid url (e.g., "https://example.com") - `files`: comma-separated public file urls - `checkbox`: "true" or "false"

actions.name: update_schema_database
actions.description: Updates the schema of an existing notion database. this action allows modifications to the database's title, description, and its properties (columns). changes to properties can include adding new columns or modifying existing ones (e.g., renaming, changing type), based on the provided property schema configurations. preconditions: - the `database id` must correspond to an existing notion database accessible with the current credentials. - at least one of `title`, `description`, or `properties` must be provided to perform an update. - when providing `properties` to update existing columns, the names of these properties are case-sensitive and must exactly match the current property names in notion.

meta.description:
Google Sheets is a web-based spreadsheet program that is part of the
    Google Drive office suite.

actions.name: batch_get
actions.description: Retrieves data from specified cell ranges in a google spreadsheet; ensure the spreadsheet has at least one worksheet and any explicitly referenced sheet names in ranges exist.

actions.name: batch_update
actions.description: Updates a specified range in a google sheet with given values, or appends them as new rows if `first cell location` is omitted; ensure the target sheet exists and the spreadsheet contains at least one worksheet.

actions.name: clear_values
actions.description: Clears cell content (preserving formatting and notes) from a specified a1 notation range in a google spreadsheet; the range must correspond to an existing sheet and cells.

actions.name: create_google_sheet1
actions.description: Creates a new google spreadsheet in google drive using the provided title.

actions.name: create_spreadsheet_column
actions.description: Creates a new column in a google spreadsheet, requiring a valid `spreadsheet id` and an existing `sheet id`; an out-of-bounds `insert index` may append/prepend the column.

actions.name: create_spreadsheet_row
actions.description: Inserts a new, empty row into a specified sheet of a google spreadsheet at a given index, optionally inheriting formatting from the row above.

actions.name: find_worksheet_by_title
actions.description: Finds a worksheet by its exact, case-sensitive title within a google spreadsheet; returns a boolean indicating if found and the complete metadata of the entire spreadsheet, regardless of whether the target worksheet is found.

actions.name: format_cell
actions.description: Applies text and background cell formatting to a specified range in a google sheets worksheet.

actions.name: get_sheet_names
actions.description: Lists all worksheet names from a specified google spreadsheet (which must exist), useful for discovering sheets before further operations.

actions.name: get_spreadsheet_info
actions.description: Retrieves comprehensive metadata for a google spreadsheet using its id, excluding cell data.

actions.name: lookup_spreadsheet_row
actions.description: Finds the first row in a google spreadsheet where a cell's entire content exactly matches the query string, searching within a specified a1 notation range or the first sheet by default.

actions.name: sheet_from_json
actions.description: Creates a new google spreadsheet and populates its first worksheet from `sheet json`, which must be non-empty as its first item's keys establish the headers.

optional.name: oauth_redirect_uri
optional.description: Add this Redirect URL to your app's OAuth allow list.

optional.name: user_scopes
optional.description: Scopes to request from the user, comma separated

optional.name: verification_token
optional.description: Verification token required to verify the request is coming from slack. You can find it in the slack app settings just below the client id and secret. It is required to enable Slack triggers.

optional.name: verification_token
optional.description: Verification token required to verify the request is coming from slack. You can find it in the slack app settings just below the client id and secret. It is required to enable Slack triggers.

meta.description: Slack is a channel-based messaging platform. With Slack, people can work together more effectively, connect all their software tools and services, and find the information they need to do their best work — all within a secure, enterprise-grade environment.

actions.name: add_reaction_to_an_item
actions.description: Adds a specified emoji reaction to an existing message in a slack channel, identified by its timestamp; does not remove or retrieve reactions.

actions.name: create_a_reminder
actions.description: Creates a slack reminder with specified text and time; time accepts unix timestamps, seconds from now, or natural language (e.g., 'in 15 minutes', 'every thursday at 2pm').

actions.name: fetch_conversation_history
actions.description: Fetches a chronological list of messages and events from a specified slack conversation, accessible by the authenticated user/bot, with options for pagination and time range filtering.

actions.name: list_all_slack_team_channels_with_various_filters
actions.description: Retrieves public channels, private channels, multi-person direct messages (mpims), and direct messages (ims) from a slack workspace, with options to filter by type and exclude archived channels.

actions.name: list_all_slack_team_users_with_pagination
actions.description: Retrieves a paginated list of all users, including comprehensive details, profile information, status, and team memberships, in a slack workspace; data may not be real-time.

actions.name: remove_reaction_from_item
actions.description: Removes an emoji reaction from a message, file, or file comment in slack.

actions.name: schedules_a_message_to_a_channel_at_a_specified_time
actions.description: Schedules a message to a slack channel, dm, or private group for a future time (`post at`), requiring `text`, `blocks`, or `attachments` for content; scheduling is limited to 120 days in advance.

actions.name: search_for_messages_with_query
actions.description: Searches messages in a slack workspace using a query with optional modifiers (e.g., `in:`, `from:`, `has:`, `before:`) across accessible channels, dms, and private groups.

actions.name: sends_a_message_to_a_slack_channel
actions.description: Posts a message to a slack channel, direct message, or private group; requires content via `text`, `blocks`, or `attachments`.

actions.name: updates_a_slack_message
actions.description: Updates a slack message, identified by `channel` id and `ts` timestamp, by modifying its `text`, `attachments`, or `blocks`; provide at least one content field, noting `attachments`/`blocks` are replaced if included (`[]` clears them).

meta.description: Outlook is Microsoft’s email and calendaring platform integrating contacts, tasks, and scheduling, enabling users to manage communications and events in a unified workspace

actions.name: download_outlook_attachment
actions.description: Downloads a specific file attachment from an email message in a microsoft outlook mailbox; the attachment must contain 'contentbytes' (binary data) and not be a link or embedded item.

actions.name: outlook_calendar_create_event
actions.description: Creates a new outlook calendar event, ensuring `start datetime` is chronologically before `end datetime`.

actions.name: outlook_create_contact
actions.description: Creates a new contact in a microsoft outlook user's contacts folder.

actions.name: outlook_create_draft
actions.description: Creates an outlook email draft with subject, body, recipients, and an optional attachment; attachments require a name, mimetype, and content.

actions.name: outlook_get_contact
actions.description: Retrieves a specific outlook contact by its `contact id` from the contacts of a specified `user id` (defaults to 'me' for the authenticated user).

actions.name: outlook_get_event
actions.description: Retrieves the full details of a specific calendar event by its id from a user's outlook calendar, provided the event exists.

actions.name: outlook_get_profile
actions.description: Retrieves the microsoft outlook profile for a specified user.

actions.name: outlook_list_events
actions.description: Retrieves events from a user's outlook calendar via microsoft graph api, supporting pagination, filtering, property selection, sorting, and timezone specification.

actions.name: outlook_list_messages
actions.description: Retrieves a list of email messages from a specified mail folder in an outlook mailbox, with options for filtering, pagination, and sorting; ensure 'user id' and 'folder' are valid, and all date/time strings are in iso 8601 format.

actions.name: outlook_reply_email
actions.description: Sends a plain text reply to an outlook email message, identified by `message id`, allowing optional cc and bcc recipients.

actions.name: outlook_send_email
actions.description: Sends an email with subject, body, recipients, and an optional attachment via microsoft graph api; attachments require a non-empty file with valid name and mimetype.

actions.name: outlook_update_email
actions.description: Updates specified properties of an existing email message; `message id` must identify a valid message within the specified `user id`'s mailbox.

perplexityai.name: Perplexityai

meta.description:
The Perplexity tool interfaces with Perplexity AI's search service, offering advanced natural language processing for sophisticated searches. The PerplexityAISearch action allows for:

    - Query execution with AI models tailored to various search tasks.
    - Search customization through parameters affecting content generation.
    - Domain filtering to enhance search precision.
    - Real-time response streaming for dynamic applications.

    This action is highly configurable for a tailored search experience, suitable for a wide range of AI-driven applications.

actions.name: perplexity_ai_search
actions.description: Perplexity ai search interfaces with perplexity ai to perform search queries and return responses from a range of models. this action manages requests to perplexity ai and processes the resulting completions, which may include text, citations, and images based on selected models and settings. key features include: autoprompting to enhance and refine queries, choice of ai models for various content and performance requirements, temperature settings to manage response randomness, top k and top p filters to fine-tune response generation. beta features include citations and images in results, and response streaming for dynamic interaction. note: the parameters 'presence penalty' and 'frequency penalty' are mutually exclusive and cannot be used simultaneously.

optional.name: scopes
optional.default: dm.write dm.read mute.read mute.write space.read tweet.write tweet.read tweet.moderate.write users.read follows.read follows.write like.read like.write list.read list.write block.read block.write bookmark.read bookmark.write offline.access
optional.description: Scopes to request from the user, comma separated

optional.name: base_url
optional.description: The base URL for Twitter API requests. For more information, visit https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs/twitter-api

meta.description: Twitter, Inc. was an American social media company based in San Francisco, California, which operated and was named for named for its flagship social media network prior to its rebrand as X.

actions.name: create_list
actions.description: Creates a new, empty list on x (formerly twitter), for which the provided name must be unique for the authenticated user; accounts are added separately.

actions.name: creation_of_a_post
actions.description: Creates a tweet on twitter; `text` is required unless `card uri`, `media media ids`, `poll options`, or `quote tweet id` is provided.

actions.name: delete_list
actions.description: Permanently deletes a specified twitter list using its id, which must be owned by the authenticated user; this action is irreversible and the list must already exist.

actions.name: follow_user
actions.description: Allows an authenticated user (path `id`) to follow another user (`target user id`), which results in a pending request if the target user's tweets are protected.

actions.name: get_blocked_users
actions.description: Retrieves user objects for accounts blocked by the specified user id; this is a read-only view of a user's block list.

actions.name: post_delete_by_post_id
actions.description: Irreversibly deletes a specific tweet by its id; the tweet may persist in third-party caches after deletion.

actions.name: unfollow_user
actions.description: Allows the authenticated `source user id` to unfollow an existing twitter user (`target user id`), which removes the follow relationship.

actions.name: user_lookup_by_username
actions.description: Fetches public profile information for a valid and existing twitter user by their username, optionally expanding related data like pinned tweets; results may be limited for protected profiles not followed by the authenticated user.

actions.name: user_lookup_me
actions.description: Returns profile information for the currently authenticated x user, customizable via request fields.

codeinterpreter.name: Codeinterpreter

meta.description: CodeInterpreter extends Python-based coding environments with integrated data analysis, enabling developers to run scripts, visualize results, and prototype solutions inside supported platforms

actions.name: create_sandbox
actions.description: Create a sandbox to execute python code in a jupyter notebook cell. this is useful for agents to communicate, execute code, see output, read files, write files, etc. it's like you own personal computer, but in the cloud. use /home/user folder to write/read files.

actions.name: execute_code
actions.description: Execute python code in a sandbox and return any result, stdout, stderr, and error. use /home/user folder to write/read files. try to not use plt.show() as the code is executed remotely. use files for image/chart output instead.

actions.name: get_file_cmd
actions.description: Get a file from the sandbox and returns the file. the files should be read from /home/user folder.

actions.name: run_terminal_cmd
actions.description: Run a command in the terminal and returns the stdout, stderr, and error code. use /home/user folder to write/read files.

actions.name: upload_file_cmd
actions.description: Upload a file to the sandbox environment. the files should be uploaded to the /home/user folder.

serpapi.name: Serpapi

meta.description: SerpApi provides a real-time API for structured search engine results, allowing developers to scrape, parse, and analyze SERP data for SEO and research

actions.name: duck_duck_go_search
actions.description: Performs a duckduckgo search via serpapi to retrieve serp data, including organic results, ads, and structured information.

actions.name: event_search
actions.description: Searches for events (e.g., concerts, festivals, conferences) by query, retrieving structured data from google's event search results via the serpapi google events engine.

actions.name: finance_search
actions.description: Retrieves structured financial information (e.g., company data, stock details, market trends, news) from google finance via serp api based on a query.

actions.name: google_maps_search
actions.description: Performs a google maps search via serp api for a given query, optionally using specific gps coordinates and pagination, returning structured location data.

actions.name: image_search
actions.description: Searches google images via serp api for a given query, returning structured image results.

actions.name: news_search
actions.description: Searches google news (via serpapi, using the `tbm=nws` parameter) for articles matching a query; precise queries yield best results.

actions.name: scholar_search
actions.description: Searches google scholar via serpapi for academic literature, papers, articles, and citations based on a query.

actions.name: search
actions.description: Performs a real-time google search via the serp api for a non-empty query.

actions.name: shopping_search
actions.description: Searches google shopping for a specific product or item to retrieve structured product listings.

actions.name: trends_search
actions.description: Fetches google trends data; the `query`'s format (single/multiple terms) must comply with the selected `data type` (see its field description for details).

jira.name: Jira

optional.name: oauth_redirect_uri
optional.description: Add this Redirect URL to your app's OAuth allow list.

optional.name: scopes
optional.description: Scopes to request from the user, comma separated

required.name: Base64_Encode
required.description: Your encoded email:api_token (Get API Token here: https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/security/api-tokens and encode it here: https://www.base64encode.org/)

meta.description: Jira API tool

actions.name: add_attachment
actions.description: Uploads and attaches a file to a jira issue; ensure the issue exists and the file size complies with the jira instance's limits.

actions.name: add_comment
actions.description: Adds a comment using atlassian document format (adf) for rich text to an existing jira issue.

actions.name: add_watcher_to_issue
actions.description: Adds a user by `account id` to an issue's watcher list; requires 'allow users to watch issues' enabled in jira and 'manage watcher list' permission to add users other than oneself.

actions.name: assign_issue
actions.description: Assigns a jira issue to a user, assigns it to the project's default assignee, or unassigns it; use when the caller has 'assign issue' permission but not broader 'edit issues' permissions for the project.

actions.name: bulk_create_issue
actions.description: Creates multiple jira issues (up to 50 per call); each issue requires 'project' (id) and 'issuetype' (id) in its 'fields' object.

actions.name: create_issue
actions.description: Creates a new jira issue (e.g., bug, task, story) in a specified project; `issue type` must be valid for the project, and if provided, `priority`, `components`, `versions`, and `fix versions` must reference existing ids.

actions.name: create_issue_link
actions.description: Links two existing jira issues using a specified, valid link type from an inward (source) issue to an outward (destination) issue, optionally with a comment.

actions.name: create_project
actions.description: Creates a new jira project, ensuring 'lead account id' is an active user's atlassian account id, 'project template key' is compatible with 'project type key' and recognized by jira, and any scheme/category/avatar ids reference existing entities.

actions.name: create_sprint
actions.description: Creates a new sprint on a specified jira board; `end date` must be after `start date` if both are provided, and some jira configurations may require sprint names to be unique per board.

actions.name: create_version
actions.description: Creates a new version (e.g., for releases or milestones) in a specified jira project.

actions.name: delete_issue
actions.description: Deletes a jira issue by its id or key.

actions.name: delete_worklog
actions.description: Deletes a specific worklog from a jira issue, with options to adjust the issue's remaining estimate and notify users.

actions.name: find_users
actions.description: Searches for users in the jira instance using various criteria like email address, display name, or username. this action is particularly useful for finding a user's account id when you have their email address, which is commonly needed for assigning issues, adding watchers, or other user-related operations.

actions.name: get_all_statuses
actions.description: Retrieves all available issue statuses from a jira instance, detailing each status's id, name, description, icon url, and category.

actions.name: get_all_users
actions.description: Retrieves all users from the jira instance, encompassing active, inactive, and potentially other user states as per jira's configuration.

actions.name: get_comment
actions.description: Retrieves a specific comment by its id from a jira issue, allowing optional expansion of comment sections like 'renderedbody'.

actions.name: get_current_user
actions.description: Retrieves detailed information about the currently authenticated jira user, optionally expanding 'groups' or 'applicationroles'.

actions.name: get_issue_resolutions
actions.description: Retrieves all available issue resolution types from jira; returns an empty list if none are configured.

actions.name: get_issue_type_scheme
actions.description: Gets a jira issue type scheme's name, description, default settings, and all associated issue types, by its unique id; the id must point to an existing scheme.

actions.name: get_issue_watchers
actions.description: Retrieves users watching a jira issue, who receive its update notifications; requires jira's 'allow users to watch issues' setting to be enabled.

actions.name: get_issue_worklogs
actions.description: Retrieves worklogs for a specified jira issue that the current user has permission to view; the issue must exist.

actions.name: get_remote_issue_links
actions.description: Retrieves links from a jira issue to external resources (e.g., web pages, documents, version control commits).

actions.name: get_transitions
actions.description: Retrieves available workflow transitions for a jira issue, or details for a specific transition if its id is provided; the specified issue must exist.

actions.name: get_worklog
actions.description: Retrieves a list of worklogs for a specified jira issue, which must exist.

actions.name: jira_edit_issue
actions.description: Updates an existing jira issue, ensuring provided field data and operations are valid per the issue's project and type settings in jira.

actions.name: jira_get_issue_types
actions.description: Retrieves all jira issue types available to the user; results vary based on 'administer jira' global or 'browse projects' project permissions.

actions.name: list_boards
actions.description: Retrieves a paginated list of jira agile boards, with options for filtering by type, name, or project, and for sorting.

actions.name: list_sprints
actions.description: Retrieves a paginated list of sprints, ordered by most recent start date, from a jira board that must exist, optionally filtered by state.

actions.name: move_issue_to_sprint
actions.description: Moves one or more jira issues to a specified active sprint.

actions.name: search_for_issues_using_jql_get
actions.description: Searches for jira issues using a jql (jira query language) query, supporting pagination, field selection, and data expansion; requires a valid jql string for `jql`.

actions.name: search_for_issues_using_jql_post
actions.description: Searches for jira issues using a jql query via a post request, ideal for complex or lengthy jql queries that might exceed url character limits.

actions.name: send_notification_for_issue
actions.description: Sends a customized email notification for a specified jira issue, which must exist; recipients only receive the notification if they have permission to view the issue.

actions.name: update_comment
actions.description: Updates the text content or visibility of an existing comment on a jira issue.

slackbot.name: Slackbot

optional.name: oauth_redirect_uri
optional.description: Add this Redirect URL to your app's OAuth allow list.

optional.name: scopes
optional.description: Scopes to request from the bot

optional.name: verification_token
optional.description: Verification token required to verify the request is coming from slack. You can find it in the slack app settings just below the client id and secret. It is required to enable Slack triggers.

optional.name: verification_token
optional.description: Verification token required to verify the request is coming from slack. You can find it in the slack app settings just below the client id and secret. It is required to enable Slack triggers.

meta.description: Slackbot automates responses and reminders within Slack, assisting with tasks like onboarding, FAQs, and notifications to streamline team productivity

actions.name: add_reaction_to_an_item
actions.description: Adds a specified emoji reaction to an existing message in a slack channel, identified by its timestamp; does not remove or retrieve reactions.

actions.name: create_a_reminder
actions.description: Creates a slack reminder with specified text and time; time accepts unix timestamps, seconds from now, or natural language (e.g., 'in 15 minutes', 'every thursday at 2pm').

actions.name: fetch_conversation_history
actions.description: Fetches a chronological list of messages and events from a specified slack conversation, accessible by the authenticated user/bot, with options for pagination and time range filtering.

actions.name: list_all_slack_team_channels_with_various_filters
actions.description: Retrieves public channels, private channels, multi-person direct messages (mpims), and direct messages (ims) from a slack workspace, with options to filter by type and exclude archived channels.

actions.name: list_all_slack_team_users_with_pagination
actions.description: Retrieves a paginated list of all users, including comprehensive details, profile information, status, and team memberships, in a slack workspace; data may not be real-time.

actions.name: remove_reaction_from_item
actions.description: Removes an emoji reaction from a message, file, or file comment in slack.

actions.name: schedules_a_message_to_a_channel_at_a_specified_time
actions.description: Schedules a message to a slack channel, dm, or private group for a future time (`post at`), requiring `text`, `blocks`, or `attachments` for content; scheduling is limited to 120 days in advance.

actions.name: search_for_messages_with_query
actions.description: Searches messages in a slack workspace using a query with optional modifiers (e.g., `in:`, `from:`, `has:`, `before:`) across accessible channels, dms, and private groups.

actions.name: sends_a_message_to_a_slack_channel
actions.description: Posts a message to a slack channel, direct message, or private group; requires content via `text`, `blocks`, or `attachments`.

actions.name: updates_a_slack_message
actions.description: Updates a slack message, identified by `channel` id and `ts` timestamp, by modifying its `text`, `attachments`, or `blocks`; provide at least one content field, noting `attachments`/`blocks` are replaced if included (`[]` clears them).

bitbucket.name: Bitbucket

optional.name: oauth_redirect_uri
optional.description: Add this Redirect URL to your app's OAuth allow list.

optional.name: scopes
optional.description: Scopes to request from the user, comma separated

optional.name: base_url
optional.description: The base URL for the Bitbucket API.

meta.description: Bitbucket is a Git-based code hosting and collaboration platform supporting private and public repositories, enabling teams to manage and review code through pull requests and integrations

actions.name: create_branch
actions.description: Creates a new branch in a bitbucket repository from a target commit hash; the branch name must be unique, adhere to bitbucket's naming conventions, and not include the 'refs/heads/' prefix.

actions.name: create_issue
actions.description: Creates a new issue in a bitbucket repository, setting the authenticated user as reporter; ensures assignee (if provided) has repository access, and that any specified milestone, version, or component ids exist.

actions.name: create_issue_comment
actions.description: Adds a new comment with markdown support to an existing bitbucket issue.

actions.name: create_pull_request
actions.description: Creates a new pull request in a specified bitbucket repository, ensuring the source branch exists and is distinct from the (optional) destination branch.

actions.name: create_repository
actions.description: Creates a new bitbucket 'git' repository in a specified workspace, defaulting to the workspace's oldest project if `project key` is not provided.

actions.name: delete_issue
actions.description: Permanently deletes a specific issue, identified by its `issue id`, from the repository specified by `repo slug` within the given `workspace`.

actions.name: delete_repository
actions.description: Permanently deletes a specified bitbucket repository; this action is irreversible and does not affect forks.

actions.name: get_current_user
actions.description: Retrieves the profile information (uuid, display name, links, creation date) for the currently authenticated bitbucket user.

actions.name: get_file_from_repository
actions.description: Retrieves a specific file's content from a bitbucket repository at a given commit (hash, branch, or tag), failing if the file path is invalid for that commit.

actions.name: get_snippet
actions.description: Retrieves a specific bitbucket snippet by its encoded id from an existing workspace, returning its metadata and file structure.

actions.name: list_pull_requests
actions.description: Lists pull requests in a specified, accessible bitbucket repository, optionally filtering by state (open, merged, declined).

actions.name: list_repositories_in_workspace
actions.description: Lists repositories in a specified bitbucket workspace, accessible to the authenticated user, with options to filter by role or query string, and sort results.

actions.name: list_workspaces
actions.description: Lists bitbucket workspaces accessible to the authenticated user, optionally filtered and sorted.

actions.name: list_workspace_members
actions.description: Lists all members of a specified bitbucket workspace; the workspace must exist.

meta.description: Google Tasks provides a simple to-do list and task management system integrated into Gmail and Google Calendar for quick and easy tracking

actions.name: clear_tasks
actions.description: Permanently clears all completed tasks from a specified google tasks list; this action is destructive and idempotent.

actions.name: create_task_list
actions.description: Creates a new task list with the specified title.

actions.name: delete_task
actions.description: Deletes a specified task from a given task list in google tasks.

actions.name: delete_task_list
actions.description: Permanently deletes an existing google task list, identified by `tasklist id`, along with all its tasks; this operation is irreversible.

actions.name: get_task
actions.description: Use to retrieve a specific google task if its `task id` and parent `tasklist id` are known.

actions.name: get_task_list
actions.description: Retrieves a specific task list from the user's google tasks if the `tasklist id` exists for the authenticated user.

actions.name: insert_task
actions.description: Creates a new task in a given `tasklist id`, optionally as a subtask of an existing `task parent` or positioned after an existing `task previous` sibling, where both `task parent` and `task previous` must belong to the same `tasklist id` if specified.

actions.name: list_tasks
actions.description: Retrieves tasks from a google tasks list; all date/time strings must be rfc3339 utc, and `showcompleted` must be true if `completedmin` or `completedmax` are specified.

actions.name: list_task_lists
actions.description: Fetches the authenticated user's task lists from google tasks; results may be paginated.

actions.name: patch_task
actions.description: Partially updates an existing task (identified by `task id`) within a specific google task list (identified by `tasklist id`), modifying only the provided attributes from `taskinput` (e.g., `title`, `notes`, `due` date, `status`) and requiring both the task and list to exist.

actions.name: patch_task_list
actions.description: Updates the title of an existing google tasks task list.

composio_search.name: Composio search

meta.description: Composio Search is an all-in-one tool for searching and scraping the web.

actions.name: duck_duck_go_search
actions.description: The duckduckgosearch class utilizes the composio duckduckgo search api to perform searches, focusing on web information and details. it leverages the duckduckgo search engine via the composio duckduckgo search api to retrieve relevant web data based on the provided query.

actions.name: event_search
actions.description: The eventsearch class enables scraping of google events search queries. it conducts an event search using the composio events search api, retrieving information on events such as concerts, festivals, and other activities based on the provided query.

actions.name: exa_similarlink
actions.description: Perform a search to find similar links and retrieve a list of relevant results. the search can optionally return contents.

actions.name: finance_search
actions.description: The financesearch class utilizes the composio finance search api to conduct financial searches, focusing on financial data and stock information. it leverages the google finance search engine via the composio finance search api to retrieve pertinent financial details based on the provided query.

actions.name: google_maps_search
actions.description: The googlemapssearch class performs a location-specific search using the composio goolge maps search api. this class extends the functionality of the base action class to specifically target locations related to the given query. by utilizing the google maps search engine through the composio goolge maps search api, it fetches the most relevant location data based on the input query. the `googlemapssearch` class is particularly useful for applications that need to retrieve and display location information about a specific area. it leverages the powerful search capabilities of google's maps search engine, ensuring that the returned results are accurate and relevant.

actions.name: image_search
actions.description: The imagesearch class performs an image search using the composio image search api, to target image data and information. it uses the google images search engine through the composio image search api to fetch relevant image information based on the input query.

actions.name: news_search
actions.description: The newssearch class performs a news-specific search using the composio news search api. this class extends the functionality of the base action class to specifically target news articles related to the given query. by utilizing the google news search engine through the composio news search api, it fetches the most relevant news articles based on the input query. the `newssearch` class is particularly useful for applications that need to retrieve and display the latest news articles about a specific topic. it leverages the powerful search capabilities of google's news search engine, ensuring that the returned results are current and relevant.

actions.name: scholar_search
actions.description: Scholar api allows you to scrape results from a google scholar search query. the scholarsearch class performs an academic search using the composio scholar search api, academic papers and scholarly articles. it uses the google scholar search engine through the serp api to fetch relevant academic information based on the input query.

actions.name: search
actions.description: Perform a google search using the composio google search api.

actions.name: shopping_search
actions.description: The shoppingsearch class performs a product search using the composio shopping search api.it specifically target shopping results related to the given query. by utilizing the google shopping search engine through the composio shopping search api, it fetches the most relevant product listings based on the input query. the `shoppingsearch` class is particularly useful for applications that need to retrieve and display the latest product listings and shopping results for a specific item. it leverages the powerful search capabilities of google's shopping search engine, ensuring that the returned results are current and relevant.

actions.name: tavily_search
actions.description: The composio llm search class serves as a gateway to the composio llm search api, allowing users to perform searches across a broad range of content with multiple filtering options. it accommodates complex queries, including both keyword and phrase searches, with additional parameters to fine-tune the search results. this class enables a tailored search experience by allowing users to specify the search depth, include images and direct answers, apply domain-specific filters, and control the number of results returned. it is designed to meet various search requirements, from quick lookups to in-depth research.

actions.name: trends_search
actions.description: The trendssearch class performs a trend search using the google trends search api, to target trend data and information. it uses the google trends search engine through the google trends search api to fetch relevant trend information based on the input query.

cal.name: Cal

optional.name: base_url
optional.description: The base URL for the Cal.com API.

required.name: api_key
required.description: API key used for authenticating requests to Cal.com. Use 'cal_' prefix for test mode and 'cal_live_' for live mode.

meta.description: Cal simplifies meeting coordination by providing shareable booking pages, calendar syncing, and availability management to streamline the scheduling process

actions.name: connect_to_calendar
actions.description: Initiates or checks the external connection status for a specified calendar, possibly returning a redirect url for user authorization to complete integration, without altering calendar data.

actions.name: create_or_update_team_profile
actions.description: Creates a new team profile, or updates one if a 'slug' matches, customizing branding, scheduling, privacy, and operational details.

actions.name: get_organization_id
actions.description: Retrieves all organization ids associated with the currently authenticated user.

actions.name: get_teams_list
actions.description: Retrieves all teams the user belongs to, including their names and members.

actions.name: list_event_types
actions.description: Retrieves cal event types, filterable by `username` (required if `eventslug` is provided), multiple `usernames`, or organization details (`orgslug` or `orgid`).

actions.name: reserve_slot_for_event
actions.description: Temporarily reserves an available time slot for an existing and bookable event type, useful for high-demand slots to prevent double-bookings while the user completes the booking.

actions.name: retrieve_calendar_busy_times
actions.description: To find busy calendar slots for scheduling/conflict detection, call this with a valid `credentialid`, an `externalid` accessible by it, and a recognized iana `loggedinuserstz`; returns only busy intervals, not event details or free slots.

actions.name: retrieve_calendar_list
actions.description: Retrieves a list of all calendar summaries (no event details) associated with the authenticated user's account.

actions.name: retrieve_my_information
actions.description: Retrieves the authenticated user's core profile information (e.g., name, email, timezone); does not retrieve related data like calendar events or schedules.

actions.name: retrieve_team_memberships
actions.description: Retrieves a list of memberships, detailing member roles and statuses, for an existing team specified by `teamid`, with support for pagination.

actions.name: retrieve_users_in_organization
actions.description: Retrieves users associated with a specific organization id, excluding individual scheduling or calendar data; the `orgid` must be a valid identifier for an existing organization.

wrike.name: Wrike

optional.name: oauth_redirect_uri
optional.description: Add this Redirect URL to your app's OAuth allow list.

optional.name: scopes
optional.description: Scopes to request from the user, comma separated

optional.name: base_url
optional.description: The base URL of your Wrike instance (e.g., https://www.wrike.com).

meta.description: Wrike is a project management and collaboration tool offering customizable workflows, Gantt charts, reporting, and resource management to boost team productivity

actions.name: create_folder
actions.description: Creates a new wrike subfolder within the specified `folderid`, optionally as a project if `customitemtypeid` is given; the folder is auto-shared with its creator.

actions.name: create_invitation
actions.description: Invites a user to a wrike workspace by email, optionally with name, specifying either `usertypeid` or a combination of `role`/`external`; custom email subject/message available for paid accounts.

actions.name: create_task
actions.description: Creates a new task in a specified wrike folder; if setting priority with `prioritybefore` or `priorityafter`, the referenced task must be in the same folder or project.

actions.name: get_account_information
actions.description: Retrieves detailed wrike account information, where the response content is influenced by selected fields, account subscription, and user permissions.

actions.name: get_all_custom_fields
actions.description: Retrieves all custom field definitions (including id, name, type, and settings) from the wrike account; this returns the definitions themselves, not their specific values on wrike items, and is useful for obtaining custom field ids.

actions.name: get_information_about_specific_contact
actions.description: Retrieves detailed information for a specific wrike contact using their unique `contactid`, optionally including `metadata` and `customfields` if specified in the `fields` parameter.

actions.name: modify_account
actions.description: Updates or adds custom key-value metadata to the wrike account, useful for integrations, storing app-specific data, or mapping external system identifiers.

actions.name: modify_folder
actions.description: Modifies an existing wrike folder: updates title, description, parents (not root/recycle bin), sharing, metadata, custom fields/columns; restores, converts to project, or manages access roles.

actions.name: modify_task
actions.description: Modifies an existing wrike task by its id, allowing updates to attributes such as title, status, dates, assignees, and custom fields; `prioritybefore` and `priorityafter` are mutually exclusive, and parent folder ids for `addparents`/`removeparents` cannot be the recycle bin.

actions.name: query_workflows
actions.description: Fetches a list of all workflows with their detailed information from the wrike account; this is a read-only action and does not support pagination or filtering through its parameters.

actions.name: find_similar

actions.name: search
actions.description: Performs a web search using the exa engine, useful for queries requiring advanced filtering, specific content categories, or ai-optimized prompting.

optional.description: The API base URL for Sentry.

meta.description: Integrate Sentry to manage your error tracking and monitoring.

actions.name: access_project_information
actions.description: Retrieves detailed information for a sentry project, given its existing organization and project id or slug.

actions.name: add_organization_member_via_email
actions.description: Invites a new member (or re-invites an existing non-accepted member) to a sentry organization via email, allowing specification of organization and team roles.

actions.name: create_release_for_organization
actions.description: Creates a new sentry release for an existing organization, associating it with specified projects that must belong to that organization.

actions.name: delete_organization_member
actions.description: Permanently removes a member from a sentry organization, revoking their access to that organization and all its associated projects.

actions.name: get_organization_by_id_or_slug
actions.description: Retrieves a sentry organization by its id or slug; use the `detailed` parameter to optionally exclude project and team details for a more concise response.

actions.name: get_organization_release_version
actions.description: Retrieves detailed information, including optional health data and statistics, for a specific release version within a sentry organization.

actions.name: retrieve_project_issues_list
actions.description: Retrieves a list of issues for a sentry project, defaulting to unresolved issues unless an empty `query` string is provided or specific `hashes` are used.

actions.name: retrieve_team_info_via_organization_id_or_slug
actions.description: Retrieves detailed information for an existing sentry team within its organization, optionally expanding related data (e.g., projects) or collapsing sections (e.g., organization details).

actions.name: update_project_details
actions.description: Updates a sentry project's settings (e.g., name, slug, platform, bookmark status); `isbookmarked` can be updated with `project:read` permission, other fields typically require `project:write` or `project:admin` permissions.

actions.name: update_project_issue_status_and_details
actions.description: Bulk update attributes of issues in a sentry project, targeting issues by a list of ids or by a query status (which implies updating all matching issues if ids are omitted).

asana.name: Asana

optional.name: oauth_redirect_uri
optional.description: Add this Redirect URL to your app's OAuth allow list.

optional.name: scopes
optional.description: Scopes to request from the user, comma separated

meta.description: Tool to help teams organize, track, and manage their work.

actions.name: add_task_to_section
actions.description: Adds an existing task to a section, optionally positioning it before or after another task in that section; if no position is specified, the task is added to the end.

actions.name: create_section_in_project
actions.description: Creates a new section in a project, optionally positioned relative to an existing section in the same project, and returns the full record of the new section.

actions.name: create_subtask
actions.description: Creates a new asana subtask under an existing parent task (`task gid`); `due on` and `due at` are mutually exclusive and cannot be set simultaneously.

actions.name: create_task_comment
actions.description: Adds a new text comment (story) to an existing asana task, appearing in its activity feed.

actions.name: get_a_project
actions.description: Retrieves a specific asana project by its `project gid`, with an option to include additional fields for comprehensive details using `opt fields`; this action does not return tasks within the project.

actions.name: get_a_task
actions.description: Retrieves full details for a specified task gid accessible by the user; use `opt fields` to customize returned data.

actions.name: get_current_user
actions.description: Retrieves the authenticated user's full record, including accessible workspaces, often used as an initial call to establish user context for subsequent operations.

actions.name: get_sections_in_project
actions.description: Returns compact records for all sections (used to group tasks) in a specified project.

actions.name: get_tasks_from_a_project
actions.description: Retrieves tasks from a specified asana project, allowing filtering by completion status and selection of optional fields for detailed responses.

actions.name: get_teams_in_workspace
actions.description: Returns the compact records for all teams in the workspace visible to the authorized user.

actions.name: get_schema

actions.name: natural_language_query_action

actions.name: onedrive_find_folder
actions.description: Finds folders by name within an accessible parent folder in onedrive, or lists all its direct child folders if no name is specified.

actions.name: onedrive_list_items
actions.description: Retrieves all files and folders as `driveitem` resources from the root of a specified user's onedrive, automatically handling pagination.

actions.name: onedrive_upload_file
actions.description: Uploads a file to a specified onedrive folder, automatically renaming on conflict and supporting large files via chunking.

meta.description: DocuSign provides eSignature and digital agreement solutions, enabling businesses to send, sign, track, and manage documents electronically

actions.name: add_contacts_to_contacts_list
actions.description: Adds multiple contacts to a user's contacts list in docusign. this endpoint allows for bulk addition of contacts with detailed information, including cloud provider details, phone numbers, email addresses, and notary-specific information. it's particularly useful for populating a user's address book efficiently or synchronizing contacts from external sources. the endpoint supports various contact types, including regular contacts, shared contacts, and signing groups. use this when you need to add or update multiple contacts simultaneously in a docusign account. note that while it can handle a variety of contact information, it does not provide functionality for removing or deactivating contacts.

actions.name: create_envelope_from_template
actions.description: Creates and sends an envelope using a template. allows multiple recipients with different roles and routing orders.

actions.name: get_envelope
actions.description: Gets the status and basic information about an envelope from docusign. this action retrieves detailed information about a specific envelope, including: - envelope status (created, sent, delivered, completed, declined, voided) - creation and sent timestamps - subject and message - recipient information and their status - document details - envelope metadata

actions.name: get_envelope_document_fields
actions.description: Retrieves the custom document field information from an existing envelope document. the documentid must be a positive 32-bit signed integer (1 through 2147483647). typically the first document has id 1, the second document id 2, and so on, but you can use any numbering scheme within the valid range.

actions.name: get_envelope_doc_gen_form_fields
actions.description: Given an envelopeid, this method returns the sender fields found in that envelope's documents. after you retrieve the sender fields, you can use the documentgeneration::updateenvelopedocgenformfields method to populate the fields.

actions.name: get_template
actions.description: Gets a template definition from the specified account. you can include additional template attributes in the response by using the include parameter: - powerforms: includes information about powerforms - tabs: includes information about tabs - documents: includes information about documents - favorite template status: includes the template favoritedbyme property

actions.name: list_all_templates
actions.description: Gets the definition of a template or templates in the specified account. note: if the count parameter is not used, listtemplates has a default limit of 2,000 templates. if the account has more than 2,000 templates, listtemplates will return the first 2,000 templates. to retrieve more than 2,000 templates, repeat the api call, specifying start position and count to control the number of templates retrieved.

actions.name: send_envelope
actions.description: Sends a draft envelope by updating its status to 'sent'. example envelope id format: '93be49ab-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-f752070d71ec'

actions.name: update_envelope_doc_gen_form_fields
actions.description: This method dynamically generates an envelope's documents by populating its sender fields. the envelope must be in a draft state. use the documentgeneration::getenvelopedocgenformfields response to retrieve the list of sender fields for your envelope. use that list to build the request for this method. for each field, specify the field name and the value to populate. important notes: - if update docgen formfields only is false (the default), the documentid changes after the update. - this endpoint does not validate number, date, or select data field values. the request can succeed even if a number or date field value is not a valid number or date, or if a select field value is not one of the allowed values.

meta.description: Discordbot refers to automated programs on Discord servers, performing tasks like moderation, music playback, and user engagement to enhance community interactions

actions.name: add_guild_member_role
actions.description: Assigns a role to a guild member, provided the bot has 'manage roles' permission in the guild and the role to be assigned is hierarchically lower than the bot's highest role.

actions.name: create_dm
actions.description: Creates a new direct message (dm) channel or retrieves an existing one, using `recipient id` for a 1-on-1 dm or `access tokens` for a group dm; this action only establishes or fetches the channel and does not send messages.

actions.name: create_guild
actions.description: Creates a new discord guild (server) with the specified name, roles, and channels; icon must be a base64 encoded 128x128 image, and if `afk channel id` is set, `afk timeout` must also be set.

actions.name: delete_guild_member_role
actions.description: Removes a specified role from a member of a discord guild, provided the member currently possesses that role.

actions.name: get_user
actions.description: Fetches public information for a discord user, requiring a valid and existing user id (snowflake).

actions.name: list_guild_members
actions.description: Retrieves members for a discord guild; requires a valid guild id for an existing guild.

salesforce.name: Salesforce

optional.name: oauth_redirect_uri
optional.description: Add this Redirect URL to your app's OAuth allow list.

optional.name: scopes
optional.description: Scopes to request from the user, comma separated

required.name: instanceEndpoint
required.description: The service endpoint for your Salesforce instance eg /services/data/v61.0, used for API requests.

meta.description: Salesforce is a leading CRM platform integrating sales, service, marketing, and analytics to build customer relationships and drive business growth

actions.name: account_creation_with_content_type_option
actions.description: Creates a new salesforce account using a json post request, requiring 'name'; specific fields (e.g., custom, dunsnumber) may have org-level prerequisites.

actions.name: create_campaign_record_via_post
actions.description: Creates a new campaign record in salesforce; if 'parentid' is provided, it must be a valid id of an existing campaign record, and if 'ownerid' is provided, it must be a valid id of an active user.

actions.name: create_lead_with_specified_content_type
actions.description: Creates a new lead in salesforce, requiring `lastname` and `company` unless person accounts are enabled and `company` is null.

actions.name: create_note_record_with_content_type_header
actions.description: Creates a new note record in salesforce, associated with an existing salesforce object via `parentid`, automatically including a `content-type: application/json` header.

actions.name: execute_soql_query
actions.description: Executes the provided soql query against salesforce; the query must begin with 'select'.

actions.name: fetch_modified_or_unmodified_sobjects
actions.description: Fetches sobjects from `/sobjects` based on caller-set 'if-modified-since' (returns objects modified after a date, or 304 status if none) or 'if-unmodified-since' (returns objects if unmodified since a date, or 412 status if modified) http headers.

actions.name: query_contacts_by_name
actions.description: Finds salesforce contact records by name using a case-insensitive search.

actions.name: remove_account_by_unique_identifier
actions.description: Deletes an existing salesforce account using its unique id, returning an empty response on success (http 204).

actions.name: retrieve_account_data_and_error_responses
actions.description: Retrieves comprehensive metadata for the salesforce account sobject, detailing its properties, recent records, and related resource urls.

actions.name: retrieve_campaign_data_with_error_handling
actions.description: Retrieves comprehensive information and metadata for the salesforce campaign sobject, provided it is enabled and accessible in the organization, and features robust error handling.

actions.name: retrieve_lead_by_id
actions.description: Retrieves details for a salesforce lead by its id; the specified lead id must exist in salesforce.

actions.name: retrieve_lead_data_with_various_responses
actions.description: Retrieves lead sobject data from salesforce, such as recently viewed leads or general lead object information.

actions.name: retrieve_note_with_conditions
actions.description: Retrieves a salesforce note object by its id, optionally specifying which fields to return; the note id must exist.

actions.name: retrieve_opportunities_data
actions.description: Retrieves all available opportunity records, representing potential revenue-generating deals, from salesforce.

actions.name: retrieve_specific_contact_by_id
actions.description: Retrieves a salesforce contact by its unique id; the id must correspond to an existing contact record in salesforce.

actions.name: update_contact_by_id
actions.description: Updates specified fields of an existing salesforce contact by its id; at least one field must be provided for modification.

optional.description: Scopes to request from the user, comma separated

meta.description: A web-based, kanban-style, list-making application.

actions.name: add_boards
actions.description: Creates a new trello board; the 'name' parameter is required for creation, and various preferences can be customized or cloned from a source board.

actions.name: add_cards
actions.description: Creates a new card in a trello list; `idlist` is required, and if `idcardsource` is used, the source card must be accessible.

actions.name: add_lists
actions.description: Creates a new list on a specified trello board, with options to copy an existing list, set its position, initial state (archived/subscribed), and does not modify existing lists or move cards.

actions.name: delete_cards_by_id_card
actions.description: Permanently deletes an archived trello card specified by its `idcard`.

actions.name: get_boards_by_id_board
actions.description: Fetches comprehensive details for a specific trello board by its id; this is a read-only action.

actions.name: get_boards_cards_by_id_board
actions.description: Retrieves cards from an existing trello board, allowing filtering and customization of fields for cards, attachments, and members.

actions.name: get_lists_board_by_id_list
actions.description: Retrieves the board to which a specific trello list belongs.

actions.name: get_members_by_id_member
actions.description: Fetches comprehensive information about a trello member, specified by id or username, including profile, activities, boards, cards, notifications, and organization affiliations, with customizable detail levels via filters and field parameters.

apollo.name: Apollo

required.name: api_key
required.description: Your Apollo API key for authentication. Obtain it from your Apollo settings.

meta.description: Apollo provides CRM and lead generation capabilities, helping businesses discover contacts, manage outreach, and track sales pipelines for consistent customer relationship development

actions.name: add_contacts_to_sequence
actions.description: Adds contacts to a specified apollo email sequence by initiating an asynchronous background job and returning its details.

actions.name: bulk_organization_enrichment
actions.description: Enriches data for up to 10 organizations simultaneously by providing a list of their base company domains (e.g., 'apollo.io', not 'www.apollo.io').

actions.name: bulk_people_enrichment
actions.description: Use to enrich multiple person profiles simultaneously with comprehensive data from apollo's database.

actions.name: bulk_update_account_stage
actions.description: Bulk updates the stage for specified existing apollo.io accounts, moving them to a valid new account stage.

actions.name: get_labels
actions.description: Retrieves all labels from apollo.io, used for organizing contacts and accounts.

actions.name: get_opportunity_stages
actions.description: Retrieves all configured opportunity (deal) stages from the apollo.io account.

actions.name: get_organization_job_postings
actions.description: Retrieves paginated job postings for a specified organization by its id, optionally filtering by domain; ensure `organization id` is a valid identifier.

actions.name: get_typed_custom_fields
actions.description: Retrieves all typed custom field definitions available in the apollo.io instance, detailing their types and configurations.

actions.name: list_email_accounts
actions.description: Retrieves all email accounts and their details for the authenticated user; takes no parameters.

actions.name: people_search
actions.description: Searches apollo's contact database for people using various filters; results are limited to 50,000 records and this action does not enrich contact data.

actions.name: search_sequences
actions.description: Searches for sequences (e.g., automated email campaigns) in apollo.io.

actions.name: search_tasks
actions.description: Searches for tasks in apollo.io using filters like keywords, date ranges (due, created, updated), priorities, types, assigned users, associated contacts/accounts, supporting sorting and pagination.

actions.name: update_contact_ownership
actions.description: Updates the ownership of specified apollo contacts to a given apollo user, who must be part of the same team.

actions.name: update_contact_stage
actions.description: Updates the stage for one or more existing contacts in apollo.io to a new valid contact stage, useful for managing sales funnel progression.

actions.name: update_contact_status_in_sequence
actions.description: Updates a contact's status within a designated apollo sequence, but cannot set the status to 'active'.

actions.name: add_organization_member

actions.name: create_a_new_organization_entry

actions.name: create_project

actions.name: delete_memories_endpoint

actions.name: perform_semantic_search_on_memories

actions.name: retrieve_memory_by_unique_identifier

actions.name: search_memories_with_query_filters
actions.description: Semantically searches memories using a natural language query and mandatory structured filters, offering options to rerank results and select specific fields; any provided `org id` or `project id` must reference a valid existing entity.
